name: Watermelon Pencil Necklace
description: Please note orders made after 19th Dec cannot be guaranteed for Christmas delivery. The Story: Once I took a broken pencil and an unravelling knit and upcycled them into a necklace mockup for an instagram challenge about upcycling. I loved the outcome so much that I had to make The Pencil Necklace a reality. The details: This is the Watermelon version of my Pencil Necklace. It is created from original Karina Jean bronze and polymer components and hand-strung on Green leather (I only use leather with lead free dyes). Available in two lengths. Short: 50cm in total length with a clasp - resting on the upper chest, just touching the collarbone. Long: 90cm in total length with no clasp - hanging between the sternum and bottom ribs. **Please add a comment during the checkout process telling if you would prefer the short or long. If you cant find a comment area, Please don't worry - I will email you when your order is placed. Please note: The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the component and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Tamani Duo Pendant
description:
available late June 2013

* made to order.

This is a two-toned leather variation of my original Tamani Pendant. 

TAMANI, pronounced 'Tum-mun-ni' is part of my ‘Geometrics’ collection, the forms of which I based on traditional geometric shapes that I then nudged to add softness and asymmetry, bringing them closer to nature.

Tamani, based on the Arabic word for eight, is based on the 3-dimensional form of a Truncated Octahedron. I modified the traditional form for softness and removed portions of each facet to create a feeling of airiness, and to allow the hollowness of the pendant to be evident. It measures 30 x 25 x 25 mm and is made from bronze-infused stainless steel. 

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. The leather is looped through the pendant, wraps around one of its links and then becomes the neckpiece. In Tamani Duo, I add a secondary leather colour to complete the neck-piece loop. When worn, the Tamani pendant hangs roughly at lower ribcage level. 

Tamani Duo, is available in a multitude of colour combinations, based on 6 leather colours: 
1 blueberry hill, 2 keppel blue
3 mehandi green, 4 snow white
5 violet femmes & 6 hot cocoa

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Seta Pendant
description:
* made to order.

SETA is part of my ‘Geometrics’ collection, a series of 4 pendants who’s forms are derived from traditional  mathematical geometry that I softened and nudged to give a more natural feel, the ‘just off centre’ and the ‘not quite even’ loveliness that is intrinsic with nature.

Seta, based on the Arabic word for six, was the final piece I designed for this collection. It is a flat hexagonal-based pendant that I kept deliberately simple, fuss-free, with clever little elements that allow it to be worn very well. Seta is made from bronze-infused stainless steel and measures 32 x 48 x 5 mm.

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. Seta is available in 6 colour options:
1 blueberry hill (as photographed)
2 keppel blue (as photographed)
3 mehandi green
4 snow white (as photographed)
5 violet femmes &
6 hot cocoa

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Seta Duo Pendant
description:
available late June 2013

* made to order.

This is a two-toned leather variation of my original Seta Pendant. 

SETA is part of my ‘Geometrics’ collection, a series of 4 pendants who’s forms are derived from traditional  mathematical geometry that I softened and nudged to give a more natural feel, the ‘just off centre’ and the ‘not quite even’ loveliness that is intrinsic with nature.

Seta, based on the Arabic word for six, was the final piece I designed for the collection. It is a flat hexagonal pendant that measures 32 x 48 x 5 mm and is made from bronze-infused stainless steel. I kept the design deliberately simple and fuss-free, with clever little elements that allow it to be worn very well. The leather is attached to the centre rung of the design and is passed through tailor-made slots in the top rung before forming the neckpiece. In Seta Duo, I add a secondary leather colour to complete the neck-piece loop. When worn, the Seta pendant hangs roughly at lower ribcage level. 

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. 

Seta Duo, is available in a multitude of colour combinations, based on 6 leather colours. 
1 blueberry hill, 2 keppel blue
3 mehandi green, 4 snow white
5 violet femmes & 6 hot cocoa

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Tesa Duo Pendant
description:
* made to order.

This is a two-toned leather variation of my original Tesa Pendant. 

TESA is part of my ‘Geometrics’ collection. My aim was to create forms that were both structured and organic, both fluid and strong. So I based their shape on traditional mathematical geometry, which I softened and nudged to give a more natural feel, the ‘just off center’ and the ‘not quite even’ loveliness I am drawn to in nature.

I wanted Tesa to have very definite facets, and a little added flurry. I wanted her to have a significant presence, and the kind of form you want to hold in your palm - a little bit river stone, a little bit found-artefact. 

Tesa is the largest piece in this collection, measuring 45 x 65 x 16 mm. She is hollow and made from two bronze-infused stainless steel halves – my own original designs. Her halves are wound together with leather, which then becomes the start of the neck-piece. In Tesa Duo, I add a secondary leather colour to complete the neck-piece loop. When worn, the Tesa pendant hangs roughly at lower ribcage level. 

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. 

Tesa Duo, is available in a multitude of colour combinations, based on 6 leather colours: 
1 blueberry hill, 2 keppel blue
3 mehandi green, 4 snow white
5 violet femmes & 6 hot cocoa

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Hamsa Five
description:
* made to order.

HAMSA, pronounced 'Humm-sah' and named after the arabic word for five, is part of my ‘Geometrics’ collection. My aim was to create a series of forms that were both structured and organic, both fluid and strong.

Within the collection, Hamsa is the pretty one. I wanted her to encompass both gracefulness and strength. I based her form on the traditional diamond cut shape, the facets of which I wanted to be present, without being overpowering.

Hamsa is hollow and made from two bronze-infused stainless steel halves – my own original designs. Her halves are threaded together with round leather, which then becomes the neckpiece. Hamsa measures 40 x 40 x 8 mm, and is worn long. 

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. The natural dying process gives the leather a slightly mottled effect. Hamsa is available in 4 colour options:
1 clover green
2 blue denim 
3 rhubarb pie 
4 night navy

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Lofty Heart Amulet
description:
* made to order.

LOFTY HEART is part of my ‘From Stones with Love’ collection, a pair of small solid amulets, whose forms are based on small painted stones. I wanted to capture the essence of nature, the softness and subtleties that are created over long lengths of time. I wanted to encapsulate those elements in metal. 

Out of the pair, Lofty Heart is the dreamer, a bringer of aspirations and a lover of love. And just like a river stone held in your palm, he will warm to your body temperature and feel like he belongs.

Lofty Heart measures 28 x 25 x 8 mm and is made from bronze-infused stainless steel strung on premium quality round leather. This piece wears well as both a short necklace or a longer neckpiece. The leather length will be made to order at the buyers choice (short styles will include a clasp).

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. The natural dying process gives the leather a slightly mottled effect. Lofty is available in 4 colour options:
1 clover green (as photographed)
2 blue denim 
3 rhubarb pie (as photographed)
4 night navy

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.

name: Lucky Chevron Amulet
description:
* made to order.

LUCKY CHEVRON is part of my ‘From Stones with Love’ collection, a pair of small solid amulets, whose forms are based on small painted stones. I wanted to capture the softness and subtleties of nature, created over long lengths of time and encapsulate the essence in metal. I wanted to bring the rightness of a found item into the form of a designed object.

Out of the pair, Lucky Chevron is the Wiseman, a bringer of good-fortune and a navigator of fate. He is the smaller of the pair, like a small sea-strewn pebble, and just like a pebble held in the hand, he will warm to your body temperature and feel like he has always been there.

Lucky Chevron measures 20 x 15 x 9 mm and is made from bronze-infused stainless steel strung on premium quality round leather. This piece wears well as both a short necklace or a longer neckpiece. The leather length will be made to order at the buyers choice (short styles will include a clasp).

The leather I use in this design is both strong and super supple and is naturally dyed with leadfree dyes. The natural dying process gives the leather a slightly mottled effect. Lofty is available in 4 colour options:
1 clover green 
2 blue denim 
3 rhubarb pie 
4 night navy (as photographed)

Please note: this item is made to order and has a 7-10 day wait. The main pieces used in this design are completely original and due to the naturally occurring variations resulting from both the metal and leather production, each finished piece will have its own uniqueness and may vary subtly from these photographs.
